means: （尤指果树的）花( blossom的名词复数 )
（植物）开花( blossom的第三人称单数 )
变得更加健康（或自信、成功）

sentence.Network_en: It was springtime and the slopes were ablaze with almond blossoms.
sentence.Network_cn: 时当春季,怒放的扁桃花使那片山坡鲜红似火.

sentence.Network_en: The spring comes and peach blossoms [ flowers ] are all open.
sentence.Network_cn: 春天了, 桃花 都开了.

sentence.Network_en: A sesame stalk puts forth blossoms notch by notch, higher and higher.

It is spring and there are little blossoms and little birds everywhere ., 春天来了 , 小花儿和小鸟儿到处都是.

the breeze carried past gusts of fragrance , like the strains of a song faintlya far-off tower. and leaves and blossoms trembled a flash the scent was carried away .微风过处，送来缕缕清香，仿佛远处高楼上渺茫的歌声似的。这时候叶子与花也有一丝的颤动，像闪电般，霎时传过荷塘的那边去了。
some prescience of thee with the blossoms white .也不曾从你看着成长的白花里，。

entry.def: Blossom is the flowers that appear on a tree before the fruit.

example.ex: The cherry blossom came out early in Washington this year.
example.tran: 今年华盛顿的樱花开得很早。

example.ex: ...the blossoms of plants, shrubs and trees.

entry.tran: 兴盛；变得有魅力；变得成功
entry.def: If someone or something blossoms, they develop good, attractive, or successful qualities.

example.ex: Why do some people take longer than others to blossom?...
example.tran: 为什么有的人比他人大器晚成？

example.ex: What began as a local festival has blossomed into an international event.
example.tran: 最初的地方节日已经发展成了国际性盛会。

entry.def: When a tree blossoms, it produces blossom.

example.ex: Rain begins to fall and peach trees blossom.
example.tran: 开始下雨了，桃树也开花了。
